biography: Chris Kalis' multidisciplinary work combines motion graphics, animation, sound design, film scoring, and interactive media. He is a co-founder of Plural Design and the electronic music collective Chandeliers. In 2015, Chandeliers composed and performed a live soundtrack to Marcell Jankovics' animated masterpiece “Fehérlófia” and the theme music to the animated short "Let it Beard". Chris has exhibited video and graphic work at the Hyde Park Art Center, the Co-Prosperity Sphere, and the Public Works Gallery. His music has received praise from The WIRE, Pitchfork, and the Chicago Tribune. He was selected to contribute design work to the<i> “X/I Ten Words and One Shot”</i> book published by Deutsche & Japaner, Germany and was featured in the <i>Typeforce 4 Catalog</i>, along with DePaul Graphic Design students, for an interactive exhibition they created for <i>Typeforce, The Annual Show of Emerging Typographic Allstars</i>. He is currently working on the score to the feature film "Orders".
